text: IL-12 - induced activation of NK and T cells occurs in the absence of immediate-early activation gene expression .

The responses of lymphocytes to IL-2 and IL-12 , involving proliferation , differentiation , and cytokine production , are only partially overlapping , and may depend on induced differential expression of specific sets of genes .
Using reverse - transcription PCR differential display , we isolated an mRNA species expressed in <extra_id_0> IL-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - but not IL-12 - stimulated NK cells .

This was identified as the mRNA encoding the transcription factor <extra_id_0> egr-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , which is expressed with fast kinetics in T and NK cells upon <extra_id_0> IL-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , but not IL-12 , stimulation .

Analysis of the accumulation of mRNA - encoding members of the AP-1 transcription factor family demonstrated that <extra_id_0> c-fos <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> junB <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> are also expressed upon stimulation of NK and T cells with <extra_id_0> IL-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , but not IL-12 , whereas expression of <extra_id_0> c-jun <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> junD <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> is not modified by either cytokine .

text: Accordingly , increased AP-1 DNA - binding activity and AP-1 - dependent transcriptional activity were detected exclusively in <extra_id_0> IL-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - stimulated cells .

Analysis of the expression of genes reported to regulate cytokine - induced proliferation demonstrated that both <extra_id_0> IL-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and IL-12 induce <extra_id_0> c-myc <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> mRNA accumulation in NK and T cells , whereas only <extra_id_0> IL-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> induces <extra_id_0> bcl-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> expression .

text: Our data provide the first demonstration that IL-12 - mediated activation of T and NK cells does not involve expression of members of the immediate-early activation genes family ( <extra_id_0> egr-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , <extra_id_0> c-fos <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , and <extra_id_0> junB <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) , AP-1 transcriptional activity , or <extra_id_0> bcl-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> expression .

text: This indicates that functional differences observed in <extra_id_0> IL-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - and IL-12 - stimulated cells may depend , at least in part , on differential gene regulation .
